logger moduleÔÉÅ

This module provides Logger class for logging colored terminal text. A colored text is defined by ColorMsg class that depends on colorama package.

copyright:

¬© 2025 by Jaywan Chung

license:

MIT

class logger.ColorMsg(text, color='', style='', background_color='')ÔÉÅ

Bases: object

Represents a colored terminal text. Text color, background color and text style can be specified. For available formatting constants, refer to colorama description.

Warning: Before using this class, call colorama.init() to initialize colorama package.

Parameters:

  • text (str) ‚Äì A plain text.

  • color (str, optional) ‚Äì A colorama constant formatting text color. Default is no color.

  • style (str, optional) ‚Äì A colorama constant formatting text style. Default is no style.

  • background_color (str, optional) ‚Äì A colorama constant formatting background color. Default is no color.

Examples:
>>> from colorama import init, Fore, Style, Back
>>> init()
>>> text = 'dim green text with white background'
>>> msg = ColorMsg(text, color=Fore.GREEN, style=Style.DIM, background_color=Back.WHITE)
>>> msg.print()
[2m[32m[47mdim green text with white background[0m
>>> msg.text
dim green text with white background
print() → NoneÔÉÅ

Print the colored terminal text without newline.

property text: strÔÉÅ

Return the plain text without color or style.

Returns:

The plain text.

Return type:

str

class logger.Logger(print_on_append=False, alert_color='\x1b[31m', alert_style='', alert_background_color='')ÔÉÅ

Bases: object

A logger for storing colored terminal texts.

For available color/style formatting constants, refer to colorama description.

Note: colorama package is automatically initialized when creating a Logger instance.

Parameters:

  • print_on_append (bool, optional) ‚Äì If True, the message is immediately printed when it is appened. Default is False.

  • alert_color (str, optional) ‚Äì The color of alert text. Default is red.

  • alert_style (str, optional) ‚Äì The style of alert text. Default is no style.

  • alert_background_color (str, optional) ‚Äì The background color of alert text. Default is no color.

Examples:
>>> logger = Logger()
>>> logger.append('plain text')
>>> logger.append_alert('alert text')
>>> logger.save_log('log.txt')
>>> logger.clear_log()
append(msg_or_str) → NoneÔÉÅ

Append a message to log. A message can be a colored text or a string.

Parameters:

msg_or_str (ColorMsg or str) ‚Äì A message to append.

append_alert(text) → NoneÔÉÅ

Append an alert text to log. The color and style of the text is automatically imposed as promised when initializing the Logger instance.

Parameters:

text (str) ‚Äì An alert text to append.

Raises:

TypeError ‚Äì When text is not a string.

clear_log() → NoneÔÉÅ

Clear log. All messages are deleted.

property last_msg: ColorMsgÔÉÅ

Return the last log message.

Returns:

The last message.

Return type:

ColorMsg

save_log(path) → NoneÔÉÅ

Save log as a txt file.

Parameters:

path (str) ‚Äì A filepath.
